answerText: death [accept "Death Be Not Proud"] [10] "Death Be Not Proud" is part of the Holy Sonnets of this British Metaphysical poet, who wrote about the relationship between lovers in his poems "The Flea" and "A Valediction: Forbidding Mourning."
heading: Collegiate Novice |2012 | 10 | 13 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  In one poem, this figure "shall be no more...thou shalt die." [10] Name this figure that, although "some have called [it] mighty and dreadful," "be not proud."
